subject: Education
title: Written Comments vs. Grades: Which Drives Learning?
description: One-minute skill: Written Comments vs. Grades: Which Drives Learning?.

hook.text: Give students comments and a grade together, and they ignore the comments entirely.

buildup.text: Ruth Butler's research tested three groups: comments only, grades only, and comments plus grades.

discovery.text: The comments-only group improved the most. The comments-plus-grades group improved the least.

twist.text: Adding a grade to feedback destroys its powerâ€”students fixate on the number and skip the advice.

climax.text: Some teachers now give feedback first, then release grades days later after students process comments.

punchline.text: The grade is the enemy of the comment.

quiz.question: What did Ruth Butler's research reveal about combining grades with comments?
options: Students ignored the comments and fixated on the grade, reducing learning gains
Students learned equally well regardless of feedback type
Grades alone produced the best learning outcomes
